trans-unit.source: Signifies that the code was generated by the serialization infrastructure and can be reused for increased performance, when this attribute is applied to an assembly.
The .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates derivations of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> that are optimized to serialize user-defined types.
The serializers are stored in assemblies that can be reused for efficient serialization.
The XmlSerializerVersionAttribute attribute stores version information about the parent assembly for which a set of serializers is generated.
Later, when the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> constructor is called, the infrastructure attempts to locate the pre-generated assembly.

If the infrastructure finds an assembly with a matching name, the assembly is loaded and the infrastructure checks XmlSerializerVersionAttribute for a match between the found assembly's version and the current version of the parent assembly.
If the version does not match, the found assembly is not used.
Instead, a temporary assembly is generated for the serialization.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializerVersionAttribute"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializerVersionAttribute"></xref> class for the specified type.
The type that is being serialized.
Gets or sets the common language runtime (CLR) namespace of the assembly.
A <xref:System.String> containing the common language runtime (CLR) namespace of the assembly.
Gets or sets the identity of the parent assembly.
The assembly identity consists of the assembly's version, assembly name, and culture information.
The version of the parent assembly.
Gets or sets the type that the serializer operates on.
The <xref:System.Type> to be serialized.
Gets or sets the assembly's version number.
The version of the assembly.
